ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: A couple hours for readings. Maybe 6 hours for assignments, spread over a few days.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course was excellent. Of all my course this semester, I felt like this was the most valuable. Strengths: well structured, assignments were well designed to engage with material and foster discussion (as were lectures). I really felt like class discussion helped us think through material critically.
Strengths: creative assignments, great guest lecturers, get print outs of the slides

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Dr. Lichtman undoubtedly knows this material and her reputation and resume precedes her. It shows over the course of the semester how much she knows about the research and the context of research about heart disease and stroke. The only weakness is that she comes across as a bit intimidating with the expectation to contribute meaningful discussion in class at a level of analysis that students just learning about this topic may not be able to offer.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Excellent lecturer and very good at fostering class discussion.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Strengths: understanding , passionate about the material, good feedback

Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Awesome teacher. She is very patient with students' questions and would continuously challenge us to think critically about the implications and roots of CVD events and their related risk factors.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Highly recommend, especially if you are in CDE, but would recommend to all.
